results.title: Simvastatin therapy in higher dosages deteriorates bone quality: Consistent evidence from population-wide patient data and interventional mouse studies.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: High-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ impaired bone @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@quality@@@ in male and ovariectomized @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

results.title: Absence of effects of prolonged simvastatin therapy on nocturnal sleep in a large randomized placebo-controlled study. Oxford Cholesterol Study Group.
results.text_hl: It has been suggested that lipophilic HMG CoA reductase inhibitors, like @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, may cause @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@. 2.

citations.NLM: Keech AC, Armitage JM, Wallendszus KR, Lawson A, Hauer AJ, Parish SE, Collins R. Absence of effects of prolonged simvastatin therapy on nocturnal sleep in a large randomized placebo-controlled study. Oxford Cholesterol Study Group. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1996 Oct;42(4):483-90. PMID: 8904621

results.title: The effects of simvastatin and pravastatin on objective and subjective measures of nocturnal sleep: a comparison of two structurally different HMG CoA reductase inhibitors in patients with primary moderate hypercholesterolaemia.
results.text_hl: It appears that the inherent hydrophobicity of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ does not increase the occurrence of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbances@@@ in this @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ population at a dose shown to elicit a characteristic hypolipidaemic response.

citations.NLM: Eckernäs SA, Roos BE, Kvidal P, Eriksson LO, Block GA, Neafus RP, Haigh JR. The effects of simvastatin and pravastatin on objective and subjective measures of nocturnal sleep: a comparison of two structurally different HMG CoA reductase inhibitors in patients with primary moderate hypercholesterolaemia. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1993 Mar;35(3):284-9. PMID: 8471404

results.title: In vivo and in vitro blood-brain barrier transport of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors.
results.text_hl: Among the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ have central @DISEASE_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009422 @@@nervous system@@@ (CNS) side effects, such as @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disturbance@@@, whereas @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ does not.

citations.NLM: Saheki A, Terasaki T, Tamai I, Tsuji A. In vivo and in vitro blood-brain barrier transport of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors. Pharm Res. 1994 Feb;11(2):305-11. PMID: 8165193
citations.BibTeX: @article{8165193, title={In vivo and in vitro blood-brain barrier transport of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors.}, author={Saheki A and Terasaki T and Tamai I and Tsuji A}, journal={Pharm Res}, volume={11}, number={2}, pages={305-11}}

results.title: A review of clinical trials comparing HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors.
results.text_hl: The side-effect profiles of all four drugs appeared similar, and earlier reports that suggested a higher incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disorders@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with the more lipophilic drugs, @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, as compared with @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, are not supported by more recent, controlled clinical trials.

citations.NLM: Illingworth DR, Tobert JA. A review of clinical trials comparing HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors. Clin Ther. 1994 May-Jun;16(3):366-85; discussion 365. PMID: 7923304
citations.BibTeX: @article{7923304, title={A review of clinical trials comparing HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors.}, author={Illingworth DR and Tobert JA}, journal={Clin Ther}, volume={16}, number={3}, pages={366-85; discussion 365}}
